p.s: The article Language learning in the UK: can't, won't, don't written by John Worne was published in The Telegraph on the 27th January 2015 deals with the dropingdropping rates of UK students learning foreign languages.
John Worne says it is a big problem for the UK due to almost two-thirds of UK businesses need foreign language skills.
In the beginnen Worne gives some statistics and surveys to inform about the drop in learning foreign languages.
Right after that he talks about the problems this change or trend has.
As the first problem of this trend he points out the importance of foreign languages for trade, prosperity, cultural exports, diplomacy and national security.

As another problem he referesrefers to a statistic which showed that almost two-thirds of UK businesses need foreign language skills and that they gave up on home-grown talent and hire in foreign countries.

After that he points out a good trend, universities giving students the chance to study a language alongside their degree subject which is usefulluseful because in the right market a language degree plus a degree is more demanded than either of them.
Worne concludes his article with an appeal to the parents demanding to think more about languages and that it takes a change in homes because the education system can't fix it alone.
His personal view on the subject is that he thinks it is a big problem for the UK and that every bodyeverybody esspeciallyespecially the parents need to change something.
